p: The plant material previously treated in the release device was immediately hydrodistilled in a semi-pilot distiller (80 L capacity) (Clevenger-type apparatus). The volume vs. time curve was obtained by hydrodistilling the copal fruit for four hours, collecting the essential oil for each period of time (15–30 min). Subsequently, the essential oil obtained was dried over anhydrous sodium sulphate and was stored in sealed vials, protecting them from light at 4 °C until being used in the analysis [ 38].
